page.title: 01WARTON AND FRECKLETON
page.content: Both the villages of Warton and Freckleton were mentioned in the original Domesday Book. Quote - "Freckulton consists of four carucates of laid and arable soil". Warton and Freckleton lie along the main road connecting the town of Preston to the east and the seaside resort of Lytham to the west. The older houses follow the main road, but there has been a lot of building over the past twenty years and housing estates now spread away from the road. Freckleton used to be a small fishing village and still has its boatyard on the Ribble estuary which dominates the southern part of our area. The main employer in our area is British Aerospace. This military airfield covers a great part of the Warton area. It is used for testing military aircraft notably the Tornado.This makes the area very noisy
